main event: Two brilliant lights were observed in the sky near Severna Park, Maryland on August 14, 1957 at around 10:20 PM.
interesting points: The two lights were moving slowly around and changing direction, but there was no noise, exhaust trail, or other lights around them.
The objects seemed to be about the size of a baseball and had a thin cloud around them that reflected their movement.
The witnesses, a man and his wife, were impressed by the strange behavior of the lights and could not explain what they saw.
Another witness, a reverend, reported seeing two unidentified flying objects in the sky over Severna Park on August 14, 1957 around 7:53 PM.
The reverend said the objects appeared as bright lights that maintained a stationary position, with one of them moving slowly to the left and back, before descending below the horizon.
sighted object: two brilliant lights in the sky
witnesses: a man and his wife, a reverend and two companions
